patch 8.2.0293: various Ex commands not sufficiently tested

Problem:    Various Ex commands not sufficiently tested.
Solution:   Add more test cases. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #5673)

attachments.text: Problem: Various Ex commands not sufficiently tested. Solution: Add more test cases. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #5673)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5b1c8fe3d588ab450d4646a0088db4efda88200a|patch 8.2.0294: cannot use Ex command that is also a function name>
patch 8.2.0294: cannot use Ex command that is also a function name

Problem:    Cannot use Ex command that is also a function name.
Solution:   Recognize an Ex command by a colon prefix.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0294: cannot use Ex command that is also a function name · vim/vim@5b1c8fe
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0294: cannot use Ex command that is also a function name · vim/vim@5b1c8fe
attachments.text: Problem: Cannot use Ex command that is also a function name. Solution: Recognize an Ex command by a colon prefix.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c036e87bd7001238ab7cc5d9e30e59bbf989a5fd|patch 8.2.0295: highlighting for :s wrong when using different separator>
patch 8.2.0295: highlighting for :s wrong when using different separator

Problem:    Highlighting for :s wrong when using different separator.
Solution:   Use separat argument for search direction and separator. (Rob
            Pilling, closes #5665)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0295: highlighting for :s wrong when using different separator · vim/vim@c036e87
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0295: highlighting for :s wrong when using different separator · vim/vim@c036e87
attachments.text: Problem: Highlighting for :s wrong when using different separator. Solution: Use separat argument for search direction and separator. (Rob Pilling, closes #5665)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f9706e9df0e37d214fb08eda30ba29627e97a607|patch 8.2.0296: mixing up "long long" and __int64 may cause problems>
patch 8.2.0296: mixing up "long long" and __int64 may cause problems

Problem:    Mixing up "long long" and __int64 may cause problems. (John
            Marriott)
Solution:   Pass varnumber_T to vim_snprintf().  Add v:numbersize.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0296: mixing up "long long" and __int64 may cause problems · vim/vim@f9706e9
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0296: mixing up "long long" and __int64 may cause problems · vim/vim@f9706e9
attachments.text: Problem: Mixing up "long long" and __int64 may cause problems. (John Marriott) Solution: Pass varnumber_T to vim_snprintf(). Add v:numbersize.

patch 8.2.0297: compiler warnings for the Ruby interface

Problem:    Compiler warnings for the Ruby interface.
Solution:   Undefine a few macros, fix initialization. (Ozaki Kiichi,
            closes #5677)
